Testimonials.author: Brian C. Dean
Testimonials.content: Competitive Programming is a unique resource that I recommend to any student interested in raising their algorithmic programming skills to the next level. It is packed with insightful tips and techniques that are hard to find elsewhere, and remarkably thorough in its use of examples and references to sample problems.
Testimonials.credit: Associate Director, USA Computing Olympiad, Clemson University

Testimonials.author: Amanda Sturgill
Testimonials.content: There are books providing coaching on various contest problems, but they aren't accessible to everyone because they are written in Russian or Chinese, according to Steven Halim, coach of the National University of Singapore team and author of 'Competitive Programming,' a book on the various types of problems found in the World Finals. 'I purposely wrote this book for everyone else,' Halim said of his decision to publish a book in English. The book covers problems contained in 40 percent of the ACM problem archive (edit: the new URL for ACM problem archive is: UVa online judge) Halim said. It contains problem descriptions, suggested algorithms for solving the problem with explanations, sample implementations and a list of examples implementations. The book is for sale at lulu.com

Testimonials.author: Baochuan Lu
Testimonials.content: I recently read your excellent book on competitive programming... I consider adopting it for our ICPC training course.
Testimonials.credit: an instructor from Southwest Baptist University, USA

Testimonials.author: Kip Irvine
Testimonials.content: I very much enjoyed reading your excellent Competitive Programming book, and I use it in a course at Florida International University (Miami, Florida)
Testimonials.credit: an instructor at Florida International University, USA

Testimonials.author: Brent Baas
Testimonials.content: Great stuff! Thanks for taking the time to put this material together is such a readable form.
Testimonials.credit: Chair of Computer Science Department, LeTourneau University, Texas

Testimonials.author: Tim Korb
Testimonials.content: Used by Purdue Computer Science Department
Testimonials.credit: Assistant Head, CS Department, Purdue University

Testimonials.author: Christopher S Mayfield
Testimonials.content: Used by James Madison University
Testimonials.credit: Assistant Professor, Department of Computer Science, James Madison University

Testimonials.author: New York University
Testimonials.content: Used in New York University

Testimonials.author: Stanford University
Testimonials.content: Recommended in Stanford University training page

Testimonials.author: Shawn A Bohner
Testimonials.content: Used in Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology

Testimonials.author: Howard Cheng
Testimonials.content: Thanks for providing this great book. I'll definitely recommend my students to study this book.

Testimonials.author: University of Waterloo
Testimonials.content: Used by some students in University of Waterloo.

Testimonials.author: Neilor Tonin
Testimonials.content: Congratulations for the new book!!! Thank you for this amazing work!!!
Testimonials.credit: a professor at URI - Campus de Erechim

Testimonials.author: Maria da Graça Campos Pimentel
Testimonials.content: Congratulations on the launching of the new edition of your book! We will use this book for our course this semester (https://sistemas.usp.br/jupiterweb/jupDisciplina?sgldis=SCC0210)
Testimonials.credit: a professor at Universidade de Sao Paulo (USP)

Testimonials.author: Joao Comba
Testimonials.content: This is a great book for a programming challenges class. I will use as a companion to the Skiena's book in our course here at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS)

Testimonials.author: André Gustavo dos Santos
Testimonials.content: We use your book in our University
Testimonials.credit: a professor in Universidade Federal de Viçosa

Testimonials.author: A Brazilian Contestant
Testimonials.content: Congratulations for your Book Competitive Programming !! Very good for Contests !

Testimonials.author: Another Brazilian Contestant
Testimonials.content: Hey Felix!!! Congratulation for your BOOK!!!! Veeeery good!!!!
Thanks for your work on your book it's really awesome!!!

Testimonials.author: A contestant from Colombia
Testimonials.content: A very good book. Previously, I solve by myself (without previous readings) the problem 10608 - Friends. Later, I read the book and find out that this problems is 'Union-Find Disjoint Sets'. Then I study 'Union-Find Disjoint Sets' and I learn the generalization for other similar problem's.

Testimonials.author: A contestant from Universidad Nacional de Trujillo - Peru
Testimonials.content: Your book will be one of the most important material that I have
Testimonials.credit: A contestant from Universidad Nacional de Trujillo - Peru

Testimonials.author: A contestant from Alexandria University in Egypt
Testimonials.content: The content of the book is so rich with information, I really like that. I am in 2nd year CS and I want to say that this book has become a friend of mine and many others. I take it everywhere and reading it whenever I have time. I am so excited (about CP3 being about 2xCP2) and am going to tell everyone to work hard mastering CP2. We are expecting much from you and thanks for your great efforts. Hope one day every computer programmer will have a CP hand book
Testimonials.credit: A contestant from Alexandria University in Egypt

Testimonials.author: Richard Forster
Testimonials.content: It is not a substitute for an algorithms textbook but it is an excellent accompanying book and one which comes highly recommended

Testimonials.author: Miguel A. Revilla
Testimonials.content: I cannot imagine a better complement for the UVa Online Judge site
Testimonials.credit: UVa Online Judge site creator, ACM-ICPC Problem Archivist, Universidad de Valladolid

Testimonials.author: Marco Antonio Gómez Martín
Testimonials.content: Congratulations for your uHunt site and your book. I am a lecturer at a spanish university and I use both of them to train some students :) Great work!

Testimonials.author: Martin Tillmann
Testimonials.content: Your book would make a great addition to our learning material.

Testimonials.author: Luigi Laura
Testimonials.content: Italian IOI team is a satisfied customer of CP book. CP2 is used for Italian IOI 2012-2013 preparation and CP3 will be used for Italian IOI 2014preparation

Testimonials.author: An IOI contestant from Estonia
Testimonials.content: Thank you for writing this book

Testimonials.author: A reader from Lithuania who now stays in UK
Testimonials.content: Received this awesome book today (mid August 2011)

Testimonials.author: A student from Russia
Testimonials.content: I am very interested to buy this book

Testimonials.author: Mikhail Goncharov
Testimonials.content: I am a professional developer who loves to compete and definitely recommend this book for anyone who want to participate on TopCoder / Google Code Jam

Testimonials.author: Janos Csirik
Testimonials.content: I would like to give a course for our students based on your excellent book
Testimonials.credit: ICPC coach from University of Szeged, Hungary

Testimonials.author: National University of Singapore
Testimonials.content: Used in National University of Singapore (Steven's host University)

Testimonials.author: Nanyang Technological University
Testimonials.content: Used in Nanyang Technological University.

Testimonials.author: Indonesian Ministry of Education
Testimonials.content: We will buy and distribute your book to our National Science Olympiad contestants 2011, as with last year

Testimonials.author: University of Indonesia
Testimonials.content: Used in University of Indonesia

Testimonials.author: Bina Nusantara University
Testimonials.content: Used in Bina Nusantara University

Testimonials.author: Teddy Mantoro
Testimonials.content: We will likely set up a competitive programming course using 'Competitive Programming 2'

Testimonials.author: Invited observer from Malaysia new IOI team
Testimonials.content: A good book to help us start our IOI training
Testimonials.credit: Invited observer from Malaysia new IOI team

Testimonials.author: several students in Thailand (notably students from Chulalongkorn University)
Testimonials.content: This book is definitely owned and read by several students in Thailand

Testimonials.author: several students in Thailand (notably students from Kasetsart University)
Testimonials.content: This book is definitely owned and read by several students in Thailand

Testimonials.author: several students in Thailand (notably students from Prince of Songkla University)
Testimonials.content: This book is definitely owned and read by several students in Thailand

Testimonials.author: a few Indians/Vietnamese/Bangladeshi students
Testimonials.content: We know at least a few Indians/Vietnamese/Bangladeshi who own this book.

Testimonials.author: Mongolian IOI team
Testimonials.content: Mongolian IOI team 2012 visited Steven in September 2012.

Testimonials.author: some Australians
Testimonials.content: This book is owned by some Australian whom we meet in IOI and ICPC
